title: ML Sculpture
description: I compiled one thousand 3D models of standing classical figures by the likes of artists such as Michelangelo and Donatello, then trained a computer to learn the morphological essence of this set of forms. Once the computer learned to 'see' in sculpture, I asked it to imagine new onesâ€”to improvise its own sculptures, inspired by the classics. These are the network's products: Each bears qualities resembling aspects of classical sculpture, but none are representational. They are not interpolations between existing forms: they are collages of archetypes and extrapolations beyond the traditional. Made in Autodesk's Artist Residency at Pier 9.
